title: No, Riot. Tank ekko is not an "alternate playstyle". It is cancer and needs to be nerfed.
body: If you're watching your own worlds, you'd see how absolutely cancer tank ekko is. Was 0-3 and down in farm, but could still duel the 4-0 rumble and win, then chronoshift out. NERF IT.

The only exception to this boards rule is when the alternative play style of the champion in question is undesirable and therefore has the boards exclaiming "nerf this piece of shit/delete him".

The thing is, Ekko's nerfs need to be for his tank build, not his AP build and constantly buffing his ratios and lowering his base damage will have an effect where people suddenly switch to his AP build and win every trade thanks to the full AP runes and a Doran's Ring only.

There are changes for him on the PBE, where utility has been taken out of his passive (Sanic) and his ult has gotten some back. I believe they're trying to reward ult plays more than just building tanky and moving fast in between fights. Looks promising.

Stop talking out of your ass.

There was no game where a 0-3 Ekko outdueled a 4-0 Rumble and chronoshifted out. There was a game where a 0-3 Ekko was able to take out a 25% health Support MF then chronoshift out. Is that what youre so mad about? A 1-offensive item tank blowing all his cooldowns to take out a low health squishy support and surviving?
ROX vs SKT game 2.

That was the game i was talking about. 

When Ekko was 0-3 and Rumble was 4-0, Ekko got his first kill by using W,Flash,E,Q,R and killed off a support MF that was around 30 health after Viktor got her that low. (To be fair, he only needed his Flash-E-R to get the kill and get out safe). So again - are you really complaining that a Ekko can kill off a super squishy, super low support Miss Fortune after blowing all his major cooldowns?
He's talking about when Ekko and Rumble were fighting botlane and Rumble didn't even try to fight because Ekko was chunking him and even eating a full flamespitter did almost nothing to Ekko.

Seriously - you guys need to stop with the circlejerk. If youre going to try and make a point, make sure youre at least accurately describing what happened.
 [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7STwkWFJGnY&t=29m5s](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7STwkWFJGnY&t=29m5s)

What do we see? We see a Rumble who blew all his cooldowns to push the wave, who was about 99% to overheat - his entire heat bar was yellow, but he didnt overheat. At that moment, the Ekko wanted to fight - basic principle: if the enemy blows all their cooldowns, they dont have any more tools to fight. So we start the duel with a Rumble who had the last couple ticks of his Flamespitter entering into the fight. When Ekko decides to go for the fight, we see that the Flamespitter was pretty much gone - Ekko took maybe 20 damage from it.  

At this point, Smeb cant risk using an ability to overheat or else he would be stuck with just autos. So he basically takes free damage until he gets back down to 70 heat, which takes about 3 seconds. During this time, Duke had all the tools available to him to fight - he used his E, landed first part of his Q, landed his W shield, and landed a couple autos for that passive proc. This was basically free damage that chunked Rumble down to 66% health. 

Smeb kites Duke with 2 harpoons, and used his shield to overheat. These are the only attacks that Smeb used in the fight - he didnt cast flamethrower again because he was overheated. During this time, Duke E's again and Q's again. Smeb walked away taking basically no damage from the second cast of Duke's E and Q. Duke was at 75% just from the 2 harpoons. 

[http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/TRLH1/1001930052?gameHash=1a9610d23d989190&tab=builds&participant=6](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/TRLH1/1001930052?gameHash=1a9610d23d989190&tab=builds&participant=6)

From Smeb's skill order, we can see at this point in the game he has both his Q and E maxed. Both his E harpoons combined did 435+120% damage. His Q would have done 472.5+150% damage. What does this mean? Smeb, using less than half of his offensive power (outside the ult), was able to hold his own against Duke who basically blew multiple rotations of his abilities (again, aside from the ult). And this was even with Duke getting the jump on Smeb. 

This is not a situation where Ekko is overpowered - this is a situation where Duke knew that Smeb blew his cooldowns and had very low resources and tried to take a favorable fight. We saw that when the shield was up, Rumble basically could tank an entire rotation of Ekko's spells. If Smeb had enough heat to use his Q, E, and W when Ekko first engaged, it wouldnt even have been close. It was only close because Duke knew he had a 2-3 second window where he could get free damage where Smeb couldnt retaliate or or get his shield up. Duke only had this opportunity since Smeb was trying to hardpush the wave so he could fight at baron - if Smeb wasnt so intent on clearing the wave as fast as possible, the fight would have gone differently. 

Look at what happened after that fight - Ekko backs off. Why? Because Rumble had his cooldowns and heat back. But when he overheats again, then Ekko goes back in to fight. Thats just great knowledge of toplane matchups by Duke and knowing when he can go in for free harass, especially when he knew that Smeb wanted to hardpush the lane as fast as possible.
